title: Somak Holidays promotes Kenya as FCO relaxes advice
text:
Somak Holidays promotes Kenya as FCO relaxes advice 24 July 2015 | By Edward Robertson Save 
Somak Holidays has produced a special 20-page Kenya brochure to capitalise on the Foreign Office (FCO) changing its advice on travel to Mombasa. 
The FCO lifted its advisory against all non-essential travel to the Kenyan beach resort on June 18, after more than a year of advising against travel to it due to the threat of terrorist attacks. 
The brochure features both hotel stays in Mombasa and safari trips in the Masai Mara game reserve. 
Somak’s commercial manager Parita Masani said: “Following the lifting of the advice by the FCO, we wanted to circulate all the deals from hotels and highlight the special offers available to Mombasa. 
“Kenya is really great value at the moment because there are airline offers as well. 
We wanted to demonstrate how safari and beach is a great combination, and this brochure helps us to get the word out there in the market.” 
Masani added that enquiries had started to “come through” for Mombasa in the weeks since the FCO changed its advice: “Mombasa has a huge following for repeat visitors as a winter destination. The resort is also popular year-round due to the [wildebeest] migration in the summer.” 
Somak had been selling Zanzibar in Tanzania as an alternative beach destination. 
“The FCO warning was just for the coast north of Mombasa - the south coast was still open but the advice put people off,” added Masani. “Now Mombasa is open for business and we think demand will pick up.” 
Kenya should also benefit from US president Barack Obama’s visit for the Global Entrepreneurship Summit in Nairobi on July 24-26. 
Somak’s prices lead at £690pp for seven nights in Mombasa with half-board accommodation at Travellers Beach hotel, flights and transfers.
